metadata.synopsis: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -644 3614. Walk up the stairs and walk towards the 2 Duergar at the top of the stairs5. Talk to the Duergar and chose to side with him and ambush the Drow Nere6. Clear the cave in ctrl+shift+K on the cave in7. Cinematic will trigger > choose option " that's your cue.." then side with the Duergar and the rebbels and kill Nere

89.speaker: Elder Brithvar
89.text: Freeze it, cock-stench. We aren't done just yet.

96.speaker: Elder Brithvar
96.text: Nere and his Absolute wanks owed us a wad of coin. And the dregs on his corpse aren't gonna cut it.

75.speaker: Elder Brithvar
75.text: Pay up, and you get to slink away. Resist, and I gut you. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

52.speaker: Player
52.text: We had a deal. You owe me, not the other way around.

34.speaker: Elder Brithvar
34.text: Deal's off, jargh. I told you to squish that floatin' eyeball. Now the damn thing's seen us put Nere down.

59.speaker: Elder Brithvar
59.text: Thanks to you, we got a cult-army on our tail. Now pay up - or I bleed you dry.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Take me on, and you'll look like a fool. Walk away, and you save face.

51.speaker: Elder Brithvar
51.text: Drugh. Fine. Besides, we got shit to do. Gold ain't gonna hoard itself.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I don't have that kind of gold on me.

82.speaker: Elder Brithvar
82.text: That so? Then your head should do nicely. Zavagh!
82.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Drop it. I don't owe you anything.

61.speaker: Elder Brithvar
61.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You've got this backwards. You keep your head, and I pay you nothing.

48.speaker: Elder Brithvar
48.text: Drugnin' jargh. Have it your way.

54.speaker: Elder Brithvar
54.text: That was the wrong answer. Zavagh!
54.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

99.speaker: Player
99.text: You've got this all wrong. I pay you nothing, and you keep your head.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Gut me? Try it - doubt you'll even pierce skin.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I killed Nere for you. That's payment enough.

5.speaker: Elder Brithvar
5.text: Psh. I'll let you keep breathin', and we'll call things square.

6.speaker: Elder Brithvar
6.text: Clan: grab your gear, wipe your arses.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

85.speaker: Elder Brithvar
85.text: Time I scrammed before more pricks from Moonrise Towers move in.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: And the slaves? What about them?

32.speaker: Elder Brithvar
32.text: Clan property. They come with us.

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Set them free, or I will thrash you like I thrashed Nere.

18.speaker: Elder Brithvar
18.text: Won't hear me argue. Your mouth's got the might to back it.

30.speaker: Elder Brithvar
30.text: Gnome-pricks: you're off the hook. Scram, before I get my senses.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

79.speaker: Elder Brithvar
79.text: Then do it, ya shit. We'll see who thrashes who.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: The gnomes go free, and you get to live. Everybody wins.

21.speaker: Elder Brithvar
21.text: Try it, ya uppity shit, see what happens.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I've reconsidered our deal, Brithvar. Free the slaves, or this place becomes your tomb.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Let the gnomes go. They'll just slow you down.

67.speaker: Elder Brithvar
67.text: Mm - you got a point. Likely to be all hobbled up, what with the lashings.

33.speaker: Elder Brithvar
33.text: Hardly. They drag their feet, and I'll scorch their arses. Works every time.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Good idea. They're a valuable asset.

50.speaker: Elder Brithvar
50.text: Born to serve, my father said. I'll keep 'em busy.

37.speaker: Wyll
37.text: Have you no heart? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

100.speaker: Gale
100.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: My gods. What in all Nine Hells is wrong with you?!

60.speaker: Elder Brithvar
60.text: Mm. For a jargh, you got smarts.

91.speaker: Gale
91.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: Pft. Sure, they can take the gnomes. Over our dead bodies. Right?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: What makes Moonrise Towers such a threat?

1.speaker: Elder Brithvar
1.text: Your brain going mushy, jargh? That's where those Absolute-freaks hole up.

80.speaker: Elder Brithvar
80.text: Goblins, drow, gnolls, even humans - ain't no one they won't try to turn. They've gathered a damned army.

76.speaker: Elder Brithvar
76.text: The way I hear tell, some prick there calls the shots. The General, Nere called him.

95.speaker: Elder Brithvar
95.text: And there ain't no way I'm sticking around long enough to meet him.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Get moving. If I see you slavers again, I'll tear you apart.

68.speaker: Elder Brithvar
68.text: Please. We catch your scent, and you'll get sliced 'fore you can bat your left eye.

66.speaker: Elder Brithvar
66.text: Now lug your arse someplace else - I got to get cracking.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

47.speaker: Elder Brithvar
47.text: Your wish is my command, jargh.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Restitution, my arse. You'll find what you need on Nere's corpse.

43.speaker: Elder Brithvar
43.text: You rakkah. Good thing you ain't one of mine - I'd be sliding a cane up your hole and twisting.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Listen, coward. We had an agreement, and I don't take kindly to oathbreakers.

25.speaker: Elder Brithvar
25.text: Shit - I've seen this jargh fight. Drugnin' animal. But sooner die than lose face.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is reading Brithvar's mind

62.speaker: Elder Brithvar
62.text: You messing in heads? I won't stand for that shit. Zavagh!
